title: Godfrey Wrentmore
text:
Godfrey 'Bai' Maynard Wrentmore (20 February 1893 – 16 August 1953) was a South African sportsman who played <a href="first-class%20cricket">first-class cricket</a> with <a href="Western%20Province%20cricket%20team%20%28South%20Africa%29">Western Province</a> and represented his country at <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a>.
Born in <a href="Okiep%2C%20Northern%20Cape">Okiep</a>, <a href="Namaqualand">Namaqualand</a>, Wrentmore appeared in five first-class matches for Western Province during the 1910/11 Currie Cup cricket season. He also played rugby with <a href="Western%20Province%20%28rugby%20team%29">Western Province</a> and in 1912/13 toured the British Isles, Ireland and France with the <a href="South%20African%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">South African national rugby union team</a>. Wrentmore, a centre, failed to break into the Test side but did play in nine tour matches for the Springboks.
